questions.question: Welcome to the Johns Hopkins Long COVID Dashboard!
options: The COVID-19 pandemic has caused unprecedented health and social challenges worldwide. To better understand the long-term consequences of this disease, a team of researchers from Johns Hopkins University and other institutions has developed this dashboard to amplify the voices of Long-COVID sufferers and raise awareness of their challenges and needs.

Your feedback on COVID-19 is important to us. We want to know how the pandemic has impacted your well-being, lifestyle, work, or social connections. Please fill out our survey questionnaire to share your experiences with us.

questions.title: Consent
questions.question: The following information will be collected to better understand your experience with COVID-19.

questions.title: Demographics
questions.question: Please enter the following demographic information:

questions.title: COVID
questions.question: Have you ever been infected with COVID-19?

questions.title: COVID
questions.question: In total, since the beginning of the COVID-19 pandemic in the US (March 2020), how many times do you think you have been infected with COVID‐19? (please estimate even if you are not sure)

validation.errorText: Please enter a valid number. Must be less than 10 infections.

questions.title: COVID
questions.question: Have you every been hospitalized for COVID-19?

questions.title: COVID
questions.question: How many times have you been hospitalized for COVID-19?

validation.errorText: Please enter a valid number. Must be less than 10 hospitalizations.

questions.instructions: The following questions refer to your most recent COVID-19 infection
questions.title: COVID
questions.question: When do you know or think you had your most recent COVID-19 infection?

questions.title: COVID
questions.question: Did you take a COVID-19 test at that time?

questions.title: COVID
questions.question: Did you have a positive test result? “Positive” means the test showed COVID-19.

questions.title: COVID
questions.question: Did you have any COVID-19 symptoms, such as fever, cough, sore throat, or other symptoms?

questions.title: COVID
questions.question: When your symptoms were at their worst, did they prevent you from going about your daily activities?

questions.title: COVID
questions.question: Did a doctor or other health care professional prescribe any medications for you to take when you had COVID-19?

questions.title: COVID
questions.question: Did the doctor or other health care professional prescribe any of the following medications for COVID-19? Check all that apply.
options: Oral steroids, such as dexamethasone, prednisone, or prednisolone

questions.title: Recovery
questions.question: Would you say that you are completely recovered from COVID-19 now?

questions.title: Recovery
questions.question: How long did it take for you to recover from your most recent infection?

validation.errorText: Please enter a valid number. Must be within 2 years.

questions.title: Vaccination
questions.question: Have you ever been vaccinated against COVID-19?

questions.title: Vaccination
questions.question: In total, how many COVID-19 vaccine shots have you received?

questions.title: Vaccination
questions.question: When was your most recent COVID-19 shot?

questions.title: Vaccination
questions.question: Which type of COVID-19 vaccine was your last shot?

questions.title: Your Global Health
questions.question: In general, would you say your health is:

questions.title: Your Global Health
questions.question: In general, how would you rate your physical health?

questions.title: Your Global Health
questions.question: To what extent are you able to carry out your everyday physical activities such as walking, climbing stairs, carrying groceries, or moving a chair?

questions.title: Your Global Health
questions.question: In the <timeframe>, how would you rate you fatigue (extreme tiredness resulting from mental or physical exertion or illness) on average?

questions.title: Your Global Health
questions.question: In the <timeframe>, how would you rate your pain on average? Please provide a number from 1 (no pain) to 10 (worst imagineable pain):

questions.title: Symptoms
questions.question: During the <timeframe>, have you had any of the following symptoms? Check all that apply.
options: Feeling faint, dizzy, “goofy”; difficulty thinking soon after standing up from a sitting or lying position
Feeling sick after you exert yourself physically or mentally (“post-exertional malaise”)
Palpitations, racing heart, arrhythmia, or skipped beats
Indigestion, nausea, feeling uncomfortably full or vomiting after eating, diarrhea, or constipation
Bladder problems including incontinence, trouble passing urine or emptying bladder
Nerve problems including tremor, shaking, numbness, tingling, or burning
Problems with anxiety, depression, stress or trauma-related symptoms like nightmares or grief
Difficulty falling asleep, difficulty staying asleep, or early morning awakenings, 3 or more times per week
Feeling sleepy, trouble staying awake during the daytime, or falling asleep during the day when you do not intend to, 3 or more times per week
Loud snoring, stopping breathing, or gasping during sleep, 3 or more times per week
Uncomfortable feelings in your legs (creepy, crawling feeling) that make you want to move your legs, that are worse at night and improved with movement
Loss of or change in smell or taste
Vision problems (blurry, light sensitivity, difficult reading or focusing, floaters, flashing lights, “snow”)
Problems with hearing (hearing loss, ringing in ears)
Problems with fertility, changes in your menstrual cycle, changes in menopause symptoms

questions.title: Symptoms
questions.question: In general, over the <timeframe>, how would you rate your quality of life?

questions.title: Symptoms
questions.question: In general, over the <timeframe>, how would you rate your mental health, including your mood and your ability to think?

questions.title: Symptoms
questions.question: In general, over the <timeframe>, how would you rate your satisfaction with your social activities and relationships?

questions.title: Symptoms
questions.question: In general, over the <timeframe>, please rate how well you carry out your usual social activities and roles. (This includes activities at home, at work and in your community, and responsibilities as a parent, child, spouse, employee, friend, etc.)

questions.title: Symptoms
questions.question: In the <timeframe>, how often have you been bothered by emotional problems such as feeling anxious, depressed or irritable?

questions.title: Patient Health
questions.question: Over the <timeframe>, how often have you been bothered by the following problems?
options: Little interest or pleasure in doing things?
Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much?
Feeling tired or having little energy?
Feeling bad about yourself — or that you are a failure or have let yourself or your family down?
Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television?
Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed? Or so fidgety or restless that you have been moving a lot more than usual?

questions.title: Medical Conditions
questions.question: Since the <timeframe>, has a health care provider given you a new diagnosis of any of the following conditions? Check all that apply.
options: Heart problems, such as heart failure or arrhythmia (e.g., “atrial fibrillation”)
Lung problems, such as asthma, COPD, fibrosis or interstitial lung disease
Blood clots in the lung (“pulmonary embolism”), leg or arm (“deep vein thrombosis”)
Memory or cognitive impairment or dementia
Stomach problems or gastrointestinal disease, like stomach ulcer or irritable bowel syndrome
Psychological problems or psychiatric problems, like depression or anxiety or psychosis
Autoimmune diseases (such as systemic lupus, thyroid disease)
Myalgic Encephalomyelitis/Chronic Fatigue Syndrome (ME-CFS), Postural Orthostatic Tachycardia Syndrome (POTS) or dysautonomia, or Ehlers Danlos Syndrome (EDS)
No new diagnoses since the beginning of 2020

questions.title: Medical Conditions
questions.question: Do you think that you are experiencing, or have ever experienced, what has been called “long COVID” or symptoms related to COVID-19 at least a month after your infection?

questions.title: Your Social Determinants
questions.question: Do you currently have some form of health insurance to help pay for medical bills?

questions.title: Your Social Determinants
questions.question: In the <timeframe>, how difficult has it been to pay for the things you need (or you and your family needs)?

questions.title: Your Social Determinants
questions.question: What is your current work situation?
options: Working outside the home as well as working remotely from home (“hybrid” work)
Working at home to provide childcare, eldercare and/or to maintain the home
On leave from a job working outside the home (e.g, sick leave, family leave, maternity leave)

questions.title: Review Submission
questions.question: Please review all the questions and answers that you have submitted so far:

questions.title: Create Account
questions.question:
In order to better understand Long COVID, we would like to check in to see how your COVID-19 experience changes over time. To participate, enter your desired password to continue creating your account.

If you would like to skip creating an account and continue submitting your survey response, just click the skip button!

questions.title: Thank You
questions.question: Thank you for participating in our Long COVID survey. You will be emailed with a receipt of your survey entry shortly!
